storyInfo: The Sarkaz and the dukes are on the verge of full-blown war. The Self-Salvation Corps and Rhodes Island make plans to gain intel on Sarkaz supply lines. Allerdale proposes obtaining the Realmblade of the Victorian Empire, together with Siege.

attributes.content: The Year 1098
1:03 P.M. \ Overcast
Palace of Westhaleg, Londinium
Even before Londinium was a nomadic city, the Palace of Westhaleg stood here.
Its name was originally plain Westhaleg. The Draco royal family convened its ministers here in this palace, and used their beloved gold and ruby to decorate the outer walls.
Said decorations went up in flames during the Great Fire three hundred years ago. Still, the building's skeleton remained, and it bore witness to the first Aslan king's coronation.
Thereafter, Westhaleg formally became the Palace of Westhaleg, to commemorate the age of peace and prosperity founded by the Draco and Aslan kings in joint.
Twenty-six years ago, the last Aslan king was captured in the same place by Parliament's standing forces.
And now, this is no longer the building where the Victorian Parliament assembles.
Sat at the conference table is but one person, not Draco, nor Aslan, but Sarkaz.
...still no sign of movement from the Duke of Gododdin... ever since the Viscount's life was attempted, our activity in the demesne has been greatly restricted...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: ...lavish salons held every night at the Duke of Normandy's residence, but the flow of raw steel is extremely suspect, and all intelligence personnel have turned up empty-handed...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: ...any sound from Dublinn is drowned out by the Duke of Wellington's high-speed battleships roaring. We've as of yet been unable to penetrate into the Iron Duke's duchy, but no other duke would be able to impede the veteran, without a doubt.
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: ...the Marquess and co. have finally given up on the Duke of Stafford's inheritance... the Duke of Caster admitted envoys and gifts on New Year's Eve...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: ...activity from all dukes has been growing increasingly frequent since last winter. It may be a sign they're about to 'reach a conclusion.' Preparations for Londinium remain at the same pace as... hold for a moment, sorry.
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: What? You're sure... Leithanien? Three days ago? This is too slow! ...Yes, it looks like they've finally found results after their diplomatic peacemaking...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: Er. New cipher's just been decoded. It's word from the frontline, General. Yes, I need to... notify you ASAP...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: Three days ago, the Empresses' Voice grandiloquently left the Duke of Windermere's demesne... er...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: (Gulps) We didn't discover contact between the two sides in time, but, just today...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: A city... a fortress changed course, and is sailing straight for Londinium. The one that's been nearest us over the past two years... er...
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: It's pushing directly from Leithanien into the Victorian border, nearing the ravine. Er, yes, it's the Kurfürst's archenemy... Duke Windermere's army.
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: Duke Windermere announces internationally... this is to 'avoid Catastrophe.'
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: Silence once again hangs over the hall. But at this moment, with his eyes shut tight, Theresis sees the thick fog outside of Londinium.
Once it clears, the battle will come, right on schedule.
Footsteps break through Theresis's train of thought.
He is forced to open his eyes.
Ther...
Theresis.
It's you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Were you asleep?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Perhaps.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Victorian dukes are a cunning lot. They meticulously sift through every word of intel that flows into Londinium, making the Sarkaz lose their heads.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The advantage isn't ours in this gamble. Yet neither have we been at a disadvantage.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Military Commission's business is always endless. Such is our history's fragility... even a single comment on a piece of information awry would suffice to forever damn Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But even now... now as we stand in Londinium, things have hardly changed much. You're still as weary as ever.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, one thing has changed.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You're here.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes, I am.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The breadth of possibilities has crossed my mind, if you were to take my head. Perhaps you would make a much cleaner job of it than I.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You would never think that way yourself. That was a hypothetical put forth by Manfred.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I am always in need of some differing voices.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: What's on your mind now?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A dream.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I saw us still in Londinium, yet unarmed.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Clouds enveloping this city, black stones growing everywhere, and the Sarkaz... the Sarkaz there in the way, between Catastrophe and the crowd.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Once the disaster lifted, Londinium's city gates were wide open to us, and the Victorians stood flanking the streets, cheering and welcoming us in.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We entered this palace, and the one sat on the throne no longer feared the black stones that grew from us, and took our hands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: He called the Sarkaz—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: 'Friends.'
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It sounds unfathomable.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There was more.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I saw Vampire, Nachzehrer and Wendigo set foot together into reaches more northern than even Ursus, casting fragments of strange monsters back unto the frigid sky.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And I saw Banshee and Damazti venture to parts more southern than even Iberia, walls against the ocean's dissent within the boundless water.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Countless Sarkaz giving their lives for this land—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And Aslan, Draco, Feline, Caprinae, Liberi... stood together with them.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Stood together?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes. The Sarkaz were no longer the nomads excluded. The land embraced us, and we had roots anew.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This dream...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This dream was not mine.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This scenario all originates from what you once described to me... a future the Sarkaz could have.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I remember.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But you told me, then, that my ideals were too distant, that it was not only our enemies who could never comprehend me, but neither could the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A myriad years of grievances became our weapons one and all, and all imposed upon me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You also told me that the flames of war within the Sarkaz would tear them apart before I led them to that future, that was more likely in all respects.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But you begrudge giving up any possibility, even if it may be but a nascent spark.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You've also said...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: That this world once was only the Sarkaz's. That the Ancients and Elders wrested our homeland from our forebears' hands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Their souls in death still murmur the Sankta's betrayal, how the Royal Court withers like autumn leaves, how our bloodline is lost in howls of grief, how ridiculous the sinners are in forgetting history, and how Kazdel's ruins strew all across Terra.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And then, they—cry out—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: —'The Sarkaz have invaded our homeland.'
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: So better that the Sarkaz believe in the fight. The fight can herd our destinies together as one. Better that than...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Peace.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This isn't fair. To rule is a method of coexistence too.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Terra will perish by its own hand before it confronts those time-old questions.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But our homeland would be more magnificent than the many of the Seaborn. Our hexcrafters would hold the northern menace at bay. Our knowledge, all-encompassing, would dispel Originium, end the Catastrophes...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Before all that, the Sarkaz must reach an answer.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You're right... they must.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is a conversation we've had countless times, but now, you can hear their voices clearly. You can make real contact with their ancient souls' tendrils. So tell me, Theresa—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: —Did this myriad of years of all the Teekaz souls that lived and breathed, and passed from life to the other shore in death—did they ever receive a momentary respite?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I've already failed, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Because you're a move behind.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Because at this moment, it is we that stand here.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Here...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Londinium.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Tell me, Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: When you stand atop The Shard and look at this city, what is it you see?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: That Victoria is a nation lush with ingenuity.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Without a doubt. In a few short centuries, they've built nomadic cities, withstood Catastrophe, even attempted to control the storm—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Not to mention those knights of white steam. The valiance of those steel suits of armor that ventured into Kazdel, two hundred years ago, falls far short of that which I saw in the years to follow.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Ah... perhaps it's the fault of our unique blood, for granting so many of us lives far too long.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: So long that in the intervals between one war and the next, we lift our heads, only to realize that, excepting the Sarkaz, everyone is progressing on.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, it's nothing to do with the length of an individual's life.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They have the opportunity to progress, simply because in the past they monopolized the freedom to choose between peace and war.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa, when I look at Londinium, I see the number of times this nation has gone wrong.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Victorians scorn how primitive the Sarkaz are, yet in essence they simply use the rules of the culture they founded to gild the greed and violence that runs in their deepest marrow.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They tear at each other, incessantly. Ultimately, everything they've made will be ruined by their own hands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: That is why we could win this chance at freedom.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Even if hope is still as remote?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I won't give up on any possibility.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes... in that regard, we've always been so alike.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Year 1098
1:34 P.M. \ Overcast
Residence of the Duke of Cumberland, Auchterigg District of Londinium

Amiya, Doctor, our Messenger has just sent back some key intel. The main Sarkaz forces are on their way back to the city right now. It's extremely likely this means they're about to wage war with the dukes' armies.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But given previous intel, even if they do return to Londinium, the Sarkaz military won't be enough to directly contend with all the dukes.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: With the Sarkaz choosing to act now, they obviously believe they've grasped some key power that'll sway the situation for them.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: That skyscraper the Sarkaz occupied? We've learned there's weaponry concealed in the building, yes, but—will it sway things?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It will, Clovisia. Have your people ever taken note... of the storm above The Shard?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh... those dark clouds seem highly unusual.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: According to the intel we've obtained, that's no normal storm at all. That's a Catastrophe The Shard is causing. Even if it isn't entirely the same as a true Catastrophe...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Sarkaz want to cause a Catastrophe? They're still in Londinium themselves. What would they gain from destroying the city?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: They plan to weaponize the storm.;What if they control where the Catastrophe lands?

attributes.content: Hrmm.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We're not just conjecturing The Shard's purpose. This weapon... or this technology, rather, is exactly Rhodes Island's chief objective in entering Londinium.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Rhodes Island came for the clouds shrouding Londinium.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Yes. It's not just a figure of speech.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: In the eventuality Theresis does activate The Shard, he'll lead the flames of war and the storm together, upon those he sees as the Sarkaz's enemies.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No Catastrophe Messenger could predict a man-made Catastrophe's course. No nomadic city could escape such a Catastrophe's assault.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Countless Sarkaz and Victorians will die in that battle, and it'll likely be even more tragic for those who survive. Most of them will become Infected.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Not to mention... The Shard isn't on the border, it's in Londinium, a nation's very capital...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Which means...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: Once the technology's complete, it'll reach anywhere on Terra.;......;We can only pray the tech hits further bottlenecks.

attributes.content: The Sarkaz... will use Victoria's power to destroy her.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: If we reach that stage, then everything the Corps has done will be for naught.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Even if we could rescue people from a Catastrophe as Rhodes Island does... Londinium and our livelihood would be past any point of return.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Clovisia, Rhodes Island is greatly thankful to the Self-Salvation Corps. Without your help, we would've had no good way into Central Londinium.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But neither I nor the Doctor will lie to you. No matter how Rhodes Island plans to approach The Shard, the battles ahead will be brutal. Each more brutal than the last.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If we can't stop Theresis within the next few days, we'll be facing an all-out war, and the dukes will march with an eye to enter Londinium.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If the Corps chooses to wait for the dukes' armies...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya... we can't do that.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I'm the daughter of a textiles merchant. Most of the fighters, in fact, are just ordinary civilians.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We have workers, farmers, craftsmen, traders. Our backgrounds are a tapestry of millions, together under the one goal of driving the Sarkaz out of Londinium as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: That's why the Corps won't place all its hopes in the dukes. Otherwise, we'd never have been able to take a stand ourselves.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Our greatest fear, if it came to it, wouldn't even be the Sarkaz controlling The Shard. It'd be... the dukes, dropping any shred of thought for the ramifications.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: So... the Corps has no intent to suspend operations?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...Correct.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: On the contrary, in fact. With war on the eve of breaking out, there are some things only the Self-Salvation Corps can do, here within Londinium.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: Such as wrecking the Sarkaz defensive line from the rear.;Such as gaining as much possible intel on Sarkaz supply lines.

attributes.content: We think alike, Doctor.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Should the dukes wage war, the Sarkaz will surely have preparations made to hold Londinium.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Being a steel fortress, Londinium is self-sufficient to an extent. However, the Sarkaz actions within the city have long since outstripped that load.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Still, unlike Londinium's previous masters, the Sarkaz don't get a drop of evident support from any of Victoria's other cities.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: In comparison, while the dukes do all act on their own liberties, they'll each have their own steady flow of supplies.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: A supply line... the Sarkaz do have some kind of hidden supply line, definitely.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Completing The Shard has been a multi-year undertaking. The idea they're relying solely on Londinium's own production is practically impossible.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It originates outside of the city, and its terminus... is in a Londinium munitions factory that builds weapons for the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Right. If we can locate this supply line...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: Then the Corps could be decisive in the coming war.;We'll be able to delay the birth of a superweapon.
Commander Clovisia, cooperation is still our best choice.

attributes.content: I'm afraid so, Doctor.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: We need more intel on the munitions factory.

attributes.content: The Corps has a fighter who knows Highbury in and out.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Doctor, you know him very well.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: Feist?;The local friend who guided us.

attributes.content: Right. He's the most suited candidate for this mission.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: With some minor preparations, he'll lead everyone away from the Sarkaz's watch, and for the munitions factory.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: We still need other, more concrete sources of info.

attributes.content: ...The Defense Force's Command HQ.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It's a tower, located at the border between Auchterigg and Highbury Boroughs, and it controls the info network for the entirety of Londinium's defense systems.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Given the supply line can penetrate Londinium, there must be records of it lying somewhere in the system.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.options: I heard the majority of the Defense Forces...;There's traitors in the Defense's top brass, right?

attributes.content: Their commander, Lettou, threw himself to the Sarkaz a few years back.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It'd be pointless to try and win backing from a treasonist. If we plan to raid their command tower, we need some other way to seize system privileges.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Of course... method aside, there's the fact that our troops desperately need new armaments... The Sarkaz have placed their sights back on the city interior, and our supplies are stretched thin.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I'll think of some way to address supply needs. When it comes to keeping Londinium going day-to-day, there's still scarcely a Victorian trader who's fallen in line with the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Allerdale?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: However, in turn, there's a different matter that I need you all to help me with.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Clovisia, Rhodes Island has brought Artorius's relic back to Londinium.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Artorius? That's the surname the royal Draco's descendants took...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Exactly. I've already checked with the Doctor and Amiya. It's the Artorius key, without a doubt.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: And that key... opens the way to the door of the Mausoleum of Kings. Which means we can retrieve the Realmblade, the 'Sighs of Kings.'
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Its significance goes beyond what any ordinary citizen would ever imagine. Trust me, please.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: It's not just some pretty piece of steel bestowed with symbolism. If we say The Shard is Londinium's great, incomplete ambition...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Then the truth of the Victorian Realmblade and the Mausoleum of Kings—that would be Londinium's real ace in the sleeve.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The Victorian Realmblade... isn't just symbolic?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Only a few nobles along with... Victoria's royal families knew about it. And I happen to be a Cumberland.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I believe you. The Mausoleum of Kings is practically a thing of myth to us, but if a royal key can open the door to it...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Amiya, how exactly did Rhodes Island even get this key...? Er, should I not have asked?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We won't conceal the key's history.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But it isn't Rhodes Island's. It bears tales upon tales that I was never a part of, and could never tell you.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: For Rhodes Island's time with it, though, I can tell you bit by bit if you're interested.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Thank you, Amiya.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I'm just... floored, really. The legacy of Artorius... the truth of The Shard...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It's as if—Rhodes Island really has been preparing, for all these years now, to be here today in Londinium.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But I won't delve any further for now. I won't make anyone else, either. It might lose us an important ally.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Phew... Amiya, Doctor, do you have anything else you want to tell me?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: There is... one other thing, in fact.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Clovisia, about my background. I'd like to have a chat with you.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...The flowers. Doctor, look at these flowers.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: They're growing.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's amazing, a place like this, in the middle of Londinium, in a Sarkaz-occupied city...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: For the Sarkaz, not letting nobles go is a net plus...;But it can't be the same for those around Miss Allerdale...

attributes.content: You're both quite right, Doctor, Miss Amiya.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Despite it being slightly neglected these past years, the Duke of Cumberland's manor is still Londinium's most iconic building.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I've not much recollection of my home out in the duchy. My childhood memories mostly tie back to here.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Nobody would ever truly leave this place to rot, would they?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Miss Allerdale!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The fact she went to lay everything bare to Miss Clovisia, while it turns out your crew were already wise to Her Highness's identity... I didn't expect that, I'll confess.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.options: Siege is a vital operator of ours.;......;Vina and I do get along real well.

attributes.content: Well, well... that reply of yours surprises me even more. Rhodes Island knew who Her Highness was... yet have been willing to treat her as Vina, leader of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Give Clovisia and Vina some more time. The Corps have their disagreements when it comes to nobles, you know, and Her Highness is... going to have a lot to say.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I'm sure you have questions for me, too, mysterious little bunny? I'd like to jibber-jabber a little with the enigmatic Rhodes Island myself, before it's time to mingle with the merchants.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Miss Allerdale... is this residence truly secure?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Hm. Rational question.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The Sarkaz naturally have their motive for not flushing out the nobles in Central. Londinium's a massive city. There's much too much for them to mind.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But... we've paid a tremendous price to sit in the middle of a war unscathed, Miss Amiya. Dignity, or what have you, is the least valuable part of it.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Given the chance, I'll explain to Rhodes Island in detail. But the Sarkaz informants surveilling this manor are under our control, and for now, I ask you trust me.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: They haven't realized we've infiltrated them. They're wrong to believe Londinium's city nobles lost their every weapon after being isolated. Their mistake.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: You still have some way to counter Sarkaz surveillance?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Provisionally...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Hm, no. If Her Highness has decided to be forthright with the Corps, then it's not my place to be covering up either.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: For the sake of a smooth partnership, I can explicitly guarantee to you all that, even now, the Cumberland residence has people who can establish extracity contact.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But the Sarkaz aren't fools. They're well-versed in war.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Indeed. But like I told you, Londinium's a massive city. They don't have enough people, they're all on their own, and that serves us opportunities.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: ...Correct.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Seems I haven't satisfied you much with my response?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: No. Miss Allerdale. I just...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Worry your burden's too heavy.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: If there really is some way for Victoria to keep control of Londinium, as it is now...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No... I believe they can.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But if they truly can, if they ultimately can, then what is it that they've been doing in practice all these years, that they've been having you do?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Allerdale's face clearly twists for an instant.
That flash of emotion is immeasurably magnified in Amiya's eyes. It's no simple resentment, nor wariness, nor panic.
It's grief.
A grief so familiar it hurts.
I apologize, Miss Allerdale... I know I've offended you.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Clovisia was right. We don't need to pry into each other. It could very well strain our progress instead, with this complex state of affairs.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But, if possible...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Please don't stifle yourself. We've seen the consequences of that time and again.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Miss Allerdale? I—I'm being too heavy-handed, aren't I...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No. Rhodes Island just keeps on astonishing me... It seems I was judging you by your cover.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I never did imagine you'd be this sort of leader. You must be at least a decade younger than me, but the look in your eyes is a very real thing.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Not to mention... heh, well, you've seen right through me. Considering you even cracked the secret of The Shard ahead of Clovisia and I, and brought the Red Dragon's key with you...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Honestly, if Her Highness hadn't vouched for you, I might just've been even warier of Rhodes Island than the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: It's true, Londinium... no, the Sarkaz, to us, have more significance still.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That's why we're here.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Well, then. You're here. What are you fighting for?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Her Highness gave me a simple synopsis of Rhodes Island. You seem to be all sorts of bound up with the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But according to what I've heard, Rhodes Island has, and has always, worked for the sake of the 'Infected.'
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: We do.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Then the two of you must have plenty more going on in your heads right now, leader and commander of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: As you say, there's a great deal of people and affairs in Londinium that we have inseparable ties to.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm only speaking personally... and for the Doctor too, when I say that the truth and the past may be enough impetus on their own at this point for us to act.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But we've already been through so much. It's long stopped us from frivolously viewing these struggles and calamities, or placing our individual feelings above the greater problem.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That's why we're here to curb a war that would devastate the land, and to dissipate the ground zero of Victoria's woes.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: To prevent the extinction of a race. To find the lifeline that by all rights we have the methods to seek.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: To help the Infected, the workers, and even the Sarkaz that have been desolated.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We're here to help 'people,' Miss Allerdale. Every single person with life. Every single person with the right to live.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Only in the end that the majority can accept... do the truths of the past have any significance.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya finishes her speech with resolution.
In Allerdale's clear look of surprise, Amiya can't help but seek her heart.

attributes.text: She's spoken her most genuine, sincere mind. Of that, there is no doubt.
The operators that work alongside her must surely be filled with the same staunch conviction. Dr. Kal'tsit stands ever more alone, carrying the weight of ideals.
So this ideal's origin, this strong flame of conviction that drives Rhodes Island to move in such colossal risk, to rush headlong into this political maelstrom—who lit it?

attributes.content: And what if—
—this answer of hers remains incapable of solving these pressing issues?
